page.title: 15Rural Transport at Cilcain
page.content: Transport is an important concern in rural areas. Many country lanes here are steep and narrow,and may be block- ed by snow at times in the winter.Most householders consider private cars to be essential, many married couples having two cars for more convenient access to places of work and shops. A school bus service enables secondary school pupils to get to and from school, but the local people are poorly served by public transport. Buses run from Pantymwyn to Mold, but services are infrequent and fares high compared to city bus routes. Cilcain does not have a public bus service, but this gap has recently been filled by the commencement of a private minibus service to Mold. Although this only operates on three days a week at present it is of great benefit to those without cars.
